DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Immunologic IgA Result Lower Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a numeric value, units of measure not specified, for the lower limit of normal amount of immunoglobulin type A (IgA), a subclass that is associated with antibody-mediated mucosal immunity, serum immunologic hematology lab.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Serum Immunologic IgA Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for immunoglobulin type A (IgA), a subclass that is associated with antibody-mediated mucosal immunity, serum immunologic hematology lab.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Serum Immunologic; refers to immunologic features of or immunologic tests done on serum.:IgA is the immunoglobulin subclass that is associated with antibody-mediated mucosal immunity.  It is secreted as dimers into the mucosa and is the most effective isotype at fixing complement by the alternative pathway, even though it lacks the ability to fix complement by the classical pathway. There are two subtypes in the human - IgA1 and IgA2.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to serologic tests to determine the presence of immunologic factors or evidence of an immune response.

IgA is the immunoglobulin subclass that is associated with antibody-mediated mucosal immunity.  It is secreted as dimers into the mucosa and is the most effective isotype at fixing complement by the alternative pathway, even though it lacks the ability to fix complement by the classical pathway. There are two subtypes in the human - IgA1 and IgA2.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Serum Immunologic IgA Lab Lower Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric value, units of measure not specified, for the lower limit of normal amount of immunoglobulin type A (IgA) found in blood serum.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The bottom of the normal range for a particular laboratory result.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The lowest value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
